definition: saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while

sentences.english: Chapter Three: This chapter is focused on the comparison between Chinese Xiehouyu and Korean corresponding proverbs.
sentences.chinese: 第三章主要考察歇后语在韩国语中的对应关系。

sentences.english: The paper studies how to translate Chinese allegorical sayings into English with the principles of equivalence as a guideline.
sentences.chinese: 本文从等效翻译的角度来探讨汉语歇后语的翻译。

definition: Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
historical or literary anecdote that gives rise to a saying
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
pet phrase/regularly used expression/manner of speaking
